[SYNTAX]: Overly long sentences (e.g., first paragraph of "GETTING A POSITION")
[LEXICON]: Archaic language (e.g., "am entertained", "state agricultural school" without context for modern readers)

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transition between "ENTERING THE TEACHING PROFESSION" and "GETTING A POSITION" chapters without a clear link
[CLARITY]: Assumed knowledge (e.g., "Department of Superintence" without explanation)
[LOGIC]: Contrast between the two young men could be more explicitly stated for clearer comparison

[GRAMMAR]: "who am dressed" should be "who were dressed"
[LEXICON]: "extreme" could be more specifically described for better clarity

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from discussing attire to the need for good general education
[STRUCTURE]: Non-linear progression of ideas (e.g., application process, teacher qualifications, and personal anecdotes are intertwined without clear sectioning)
[CLARITY]: The connection between some anecdotes and the main points could be more explicitly stated
